snippet: For its second season “The Franchise” shows, with an apparent lack of sugarcoating, the Miami Marlins on a losing streak.
abstract: Mike Hale says Showtime baseball television documentary series The Franchise, which follows the Miami Martins; says that show has benefited from team's poor performance, because bad baseball makes for good television, proving one of the general rules of reality TV.
lead_paragraph: For its second season “The Franchise” shows, with an apparent lack of sugarcoating, the Miami Marlins on a losing streak.

headline.seo: On ‘The Franchise,’ Miami Marlins Flail but Deliver
headline.main: Proving the Reality TV Rule That Nothing Succeeds Like Failure
headline.print_headline: Proving the Reality TV Rule That Nothing Succeeds Like Failure
